chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erika R. Braatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles T&R in defendant's name, as on defendant himself.  IID to be installed within 14 days.

miscConds.notes: AODA and be in full compliance  with drivers safety plan as a result from that assessment.
AODA and be in full compliance  with drivers safety plan as a result from that assessment.

Defendant must comply with all terms and conditions of Marathon County OWI Court.  

Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan.  

IID order and DL revocation order as condition of probation. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 9 months TO BE SERVED CONSECUTIVE to the jail as a condition of probation in 14CF6.  3 months I&S to be used for rule violations.  Jail time with huber for work, treatment, child care if defendant qualifies under jail classification system.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Initial Appearance 10.27.15
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF879 and 15CF97 called: 2:50pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Kronenwetter.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable.
14CF879>>SENTENCE AFTER REV; 15CF97>>PLEA/SENTENCING

15CF97>>State notes that only remaining charge in information is Ct. 1 (OWI 5th/Repeater)
State moves to: 
15CF97 - Ct. 1 (OWI 5th/Repeater)>>AMEND to DELETE Repeater allegation
COURT grants above.

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF879>>9 months MCJ commencing immediately w/huber for work/treatment/child care if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; 161 days of credit for time served; All financial obligations remain under the probation she is serving under 14CF6.

15CF97>>6 years prison TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, I&S; 3 years probation
CONDITIONS: AODA and be in full compliance w/drivers safety plan as a result from that assessment; Defendant must comply with all terms and conditions of MC OWI court; $2452 inclusive; 1 year MCJ total--9 months to be served consecutive to the jail as condition of probation in 14CF6 and 3 months I&S to be used for rule violations, w/credit for 161 days credit for time served, w/huber for work/treatment/child care if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; 36 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA and any follow up recommended; Absolute sobriety; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 36 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation.

Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP if defendant revoked.
